document_title: Right-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Right-sided migraine is a condition in which pain occurs on the right side of the head. Right-sided migraines can occur in a certain location on the right side of the head or spread around the temple and eye socket. In some cases, migraines can spread to the neck.
Migraines, depending on the cause of the pain, can be persistent or throbbing in waves, accompanied by a number of other symptoms such as dizziness, nausea and visual disturbances, temporary loss of vision, sweating, stiff shoulder muscles, fatigue, etc.
